text: Colocation is a Internet network service which involves the physical placement of client's servers on the technical site of a provider, or provision by the provider for lease to the user of its own server. Colocation facilities provide space, power, cooling, and physical security for the server, storage, and networking equipment of other firms and also connect them to a variety of telecommunications and network service providers with a minimum of cost and complexity. == Related pages == * Data center == References == Category:Internet
title: Colocation centre
